btrplace.solver.choco.view

Class CShareableResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • btrplace.solver.choco.view.CShareableResource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChocoView

    public class CShareableResource
extends Object
implements ChocoView
    Specify, for a given resource, the physical resource usage associated to each server, and the virtual resource usage consumed by each of the VMs they host.
    Author:
    Fabien Hermenier

    • Nested Class Summary

      static class  CShareableResource.Builder
      Builder associated to the constraint.

      static double UNCHECKED_RATIO

      • getPhysicalUsage

        public solver.variables.IntVar getPhysicalUsage(int nIdx)
        Get the physical resource usage of a given node
        Parameters:
        nIdx - the node identifier
        Returns:
        the variable denoting the resource usage for the node. null if the node is unknown

      • getVirtualUsage

        public solver.variables.IntVar[] getVirtualUsage()
        Get the virtual resource usage that is made by the VMs on the nodes. Warning: the only possible approach to restrict these value is to increase their upper bound using the associated setSup() method
        Returns:
        an array of variables denoting each node virtual resource usage.

      • getVirtualUsage

        public solver.variables.IntVar getVirtualUsage(int nIdx)
        Get the virtual resource usage of a given node. Warning: the only possible approach to restrict the value is to increase their upper bound using the associated setSup() method
        Parameters:
        nIdx - the node identifier
        Returns:
        the variable denoting the resource usage for the node. null if the node is unknown

      • getVMsAllocation

        public solver.variables.IntVar[] getVMsAllocation()
        Get the amount of virtual resource to allocate to each VM. Warning: the only possible approach to restrict these value is to increase their lower bound using the associated setInf() method
        Returns:
        an array of variables denoting each VM vmAllocation

      • getVMsAllocation

        public solver.variables.IntVar getVMsAllocation(int vmIdx)
        Get the amount of virtual resource to allocate a given VM. Warning: the only possible approach to restrict this value is to increase their lower bound using the associated setInf() method
        Parameters:
        vmIdx - the VM identifier
        Returns:
        the variable denoting the virtual resources to allocate to the VM. null if the VM is unknown

      • getOverbookRatio

        public solver.variables.RealVar getOverbookRatio(int nId)
        Get the overbooking ratio for a node. WARNING: it is only allowed to reduce the upper-bound of the ratio using #setSup(x) methods
        Parameters:
        nId - the node identifier
        Returns:
        an array of ratios.

      • getOverbookRatios

        public solver.variables.RealVar[] getOverbookRatios()
        Get the overbooking ratios for every nodes. WARNING: it is only allowed to reduce the upper-bound of the ratio using #setSup(x) methods
        Returns:
        an array of ratios.

      • addAllocateAction

        public boolean addAllocateAction(ReconfigurationPlan plan,
                                 VM e,
                                 Node node,
                                 int st,
                                 int ed)
        Generate and addDim an Allocate action if the amount of resources allocated to a VM has changed. The action schedule must be known.
        Parameters:
        e - the VM identifier
        node - the identifier of the node that is currently hosting the VM
        st - the moment that action starts
        ed - the moment the action ends
        Returns:
        true if the action has been added to the plan,false otherwise

      • beforeSolve

        public boolean beforeSolve(ReconfigurationProblem p)
                    throws SolverException
        Set the resource usage for each of the VM. If the LB is < 0 , the previous consumption is used to maintain the resource usage. Otherwise, the usage is set to the variable lower bound.
        Specified by:
        beforeSolve in interface ChocoView
        Returns:
        false if an operation leads to a problem without solution
        Throws:
        SolverException - if an error occurred while building the problem

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public boolean cloneVM(VM vm,
                       VM clone)
        Description copied from interface: ChocoView

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
